title: BBC Local Live: Coventry & Warwickshire on Friday 10 March 2017 - BBC News

coventry teen recognised for refugee work .
woakes stars in west indies whitewash .

documents.title: coming up on tv
text: it 's a blight on our landscape , a health hazard and it is costing us millions - fly-tipping .
we investigate the cost to councils in the west midlands of clearing it .
the chief constable of west midlands police has denied his force is engaged in `` positive discrimination '' in the recruitment of black and ethnic minority officers .
two non-league sides , bromsgrove sporting and coleshill town , have made it to the semi-finals of the fa vase , and are dreaming of meeting each other in the final in may .
more on these stories and others on the midlands today on bbc one from 18:30 .
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: the $ 370m deal to build electric cars and suvs in leamington
text: a $ 370million deal has been signed to begin large scale production of a range of electric sports cars and suvs in leamington .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: listen : 'make me comfortable but do n't resuscitate me '
text: `` do not resuscitate '' forms are controversial .
they are kept in a patients ' medical notes and completed by the doctor , in consultation with the patient or their next of kin , if they are too unwell .
it means if the patients ' heart stops , they do n't want doctors to re-start it .
what 's not well known is that doctors and nurses can mistakenly think that other treatment should not be given .
the patient is less likely to be admitted to an intensive care unit .
a trial to replace those forms , tested in coventry and birmingham , is be be rolled out across the country .
hear why one patient has chosen to not be resuscitated .

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: overnight it is going to remain mostly cloudy with some hill fog .
however , there will also be a few cloud breaks around at times .
lows of 8c ( 46f ) .
find out more about the weekend ahead .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: three things you wanted to know
text: three things you wanted to know

documents.title: 'export champions ' to offer advice on overseas business
text: a warwickshire business has been named by the government as one of 13 'export champions ' in the west midlands as part of a programme to encourage overseas business .

james blakemore , of marketing company jmb partnership in warwick , was named by international trade minister , mark garnier , as part of a team who can offer expertise and advice to other companies .
the announcement comes a day after the launch of the government 's midlands engine strategy , in which coventry and warwickshire are set to receive £ 42.44m worth of investment .

documents.title: slideshow : up close with nature
text: some great photos taken by the bbc 's army of weather watchers in warwickshire today .
these come from daisynics , kingfisher whisperer , anne 's garden and maid marion .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: fly-tipping costs soar as incidents rise steeply
text: the cost of cleaning up fly-tipping across the west midlands reached £ 3m last year .
in north warwickshire the number of fly-tipping incidents rose from 422 in the year 2012 to 2013 to 788 in 2015 to 2016 .
the problem has almost doubled in stratford-upon-avon , with 282 incidents last year and the number of incidents in rugby borough have risen by a third to 865 in the same period .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: bears sign de grandhomme for t20 blast
text: bears sign de grandhomme for t20 blast

documents.title: kenilworth taxi firm apologises after leaving wheelchair user stranded
text: a kenilworth taxi firm has apologised after leaving a wheelchair user stranded last weekend .
author: Leamington Courier

documents.title: vying to be west midlands 'metro mayor '
text: vying to be west midlands 'metro mayor '

documents.title: woman fined hundreds of pounds for dropping cigarette butt in atherstone
text: despite being sent multiple requests , the woman failed to contact the council , landing herself a £ 430 fine .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: trial of replacement for 'do not resuscitate ' orders extended
text: a trial to replace `` do not resuscitate '' orders , tested in coventry and birmingham , is be be rolled out across the country .
the scheme , called respect , involves having conversations between patients , relatives and healthcare professionals , and creating a plan for their `` end of life '' .
it also includes better training for clinicians to initiate difficult conversations , and a more detailed , version of the notice .

dr zoe fritz , part of the respect working group and a fellow in society and ethics at the university of warwick , said the new process has been carefully developed to `` nudge patients and doctors into having difficult conversations '' .

documents.title: appeal to find missing derby man
text: derbyshire police is appealing for information on the whereabouts of lakhbir kalirai , from sunny hill , who was reported missing at 10:00 yesterday .
the 42-year-old has been described as 6ft 4ins tall , bald and of slim build , with several tattoos .
he drives a vauxhall corsa and has links to leamington spa .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: watch : driverless pod gets to grips with street trial
text: engineers are working with driverless pods , made by rdm group in coventry , ahead of a trials on the streets of milton keynes .
the self-driving vehicles will also be tested in coventry under the government 's three- year scheme , uk autodrive .
uk autodrive will have 40 # driverless @ twitterid pods in mk by next summer .
this is pod 2 getting to know its way around town .
get off the pavement please .
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
it 's a test vehicle , micro car not full sized , doubt it would `` want '' to stay on pavements
the only good thing is it 's being shepherded .
bring back the man with the red flag !
i think a 15mph microcar on the m1 would be just that !
to be fair i 'm not sure it would encounter that many pedestrians on pavements in mk @ twitterid @ twitterid
in central mk ?
loads !
on the red routes , it could probably sneak 70 , who would know ?
not our redway to cmk .
children , wheelchairs , dog walkers , cyclists
so we could add microcars , pedelecs , scooters to that
how about showing what happens when a person walks in front of it ?
as opposed when a person cycles in front of a van driven by a cyborg ?
saw pod in middleton hall exhibition .
not accessible , too cramped .
catalyst tv hs worrying footage re pedestrians
what is the point in this ?
for disabled people ?
or for people to walk less ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid if all cars where autonomous it 'd be easy to design , transitioning as humans still drive is hard

documents.title: funds raised to help family with costs of funeral for warwick woman
text: a fundraising campaign has been launched to help the family of a 31-year-old warwick woman who tragically died after a fire broke out .
author: Kenilworth Weekly News

documents.title: coming up on tv
text: the cost to councils in the west midlands of cleaning up fly-tipping reached £ 3m last year .
we will be exploring the roots of the problem .
a south yorkshire police officer claims the west midlands force has `` pushed the boundaries of positive action too far '' when it comes to recruiting black and ethnic minority officers .
and supporters of two non-league football teams from the west midlands are dreaming of a trip to wembley .
coleshill town and bromsgrove sporting have both reached the semi-finals of the fa vase .
more on these stories and others on the midlands today on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: Nicola Beckford
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: alcester woman battling back from bleed on brain
text: on our front page this week : a nursery nurse is looking to the future after she `` miraculously survived '' .
a bleed on her brain which she thought was just a hangover .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: conservatives hold stratford district seat
text: the conservatives held the stratford-on-avon seat of red horse in yesterday 's by-election .
john fielding was the successful candidate , after the vote called due to the resignation of district councillor bart dalla mura .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: coleshill town two matches away from wembley
text: coleshill town play the biggest game in their history tomorrow , when they meet south shields in the semi-final of the fa vase .
the club is expecting more than 1,500 fans for the home leg of the competition , with the second leg taking place on saturday , 18 march at mariners park .

documents.title: headteachers unite against school cuts in and around warwick district
text: headteachers of seven secondary schools in and around warwick district have united against government proposals which could result in schools ' funding being slashed
author: Leamington Courier

documents.title: football : midfielder blow for sky blues
text: the sky blues will be without midfield player andy rose for mark robins ' first match in his second spell as manager .
rose was knocked out during the draw at shrewsbury and also suffered a knee injury , say the club .
coventry take on fifth-placed bradford city at the ricoh arena tomorrow .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: teenager recognised for work to help refugee women
text: a coventry-based teenager , who fled to the uk ten years ago , has been recognised as the un refugee agency 's young woman of the year for her work to help other girls .
rozin hanjool 's family are part of the yazidi minority group , originally from northern iraq .
two years ago she started a petition to support and protect abducted and enslaved yazidi girls , which now has 275,000 signatures .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: could global property player quit coventry ?
text: a global property player which dropped out of a move to a new £ 100million coventry business district has refused to say whether it might leave the city altogether .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: cricket : woakes stars in west indies whitewash
text: warwickshire 's chris woakes was named man of the series as england whitewashed the west indies with victory in their third and final one day international .
alex hales and joe root struck centuries as england steamrollered the hosts by 186 runs in barbados in the third match , and liam plunkett and woakes took three wickets each with the ball .
author: BBC WM Sport

documents.title: zoo boss wins women 's award
text: congratulations to dr sharon redrobe .
the chief executive of twycross zoo has been named `` inspirational woman of the year '' at the enterprising women awards .
she was chosen from dozens of nominations for the accolade .
dr redrobe is a primate expert and has more than 70 journal and book publications .
the awards recognise the achievements of women in business .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: mp calls for debate on problem of fly-tipping
text: there 's been a call for a debate in parliament over fly-tipping after a warwickshire village was blocked-off because of a mountain of dumped waste .
the rubbish , which prevented access to austrey near atherstone , was dumped last month and has now been cleared .
conservative mp for north warwickshire , craig tracey , told the commons it was `` unacceptable '' and the problem was causing the local council around £ 650,000 a year .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: watch : weather for the west midlands
text: a cloudy day in store with occasional light drizzle , but also some patches of brightness - highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: indoor park included in co-op plans
text: an indoor park is to be created as part of the redevelopment of coventry 's former co-op store , says the company behind the scheme .
neil edington , from edg property , who also redeveloped the cube in birmingham , said a park for residents would be developed by removing a section of the building .
they 've negotiated to use the co-operative as the name , retaining the original lettering and keeping the facade of the original building .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your enjoying the sunshine
text: it 's been a great start to the day , as you can see from these photos taken by bbc weather watchers .
steve c took his in warwick , and old salt captured the day in southam .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: man jailed for drug and driving offences
text: a rugby man has been sentenced to 14 months in prison , after admitting drug and driving offences at warwick crown court .
nathan douglas , 27 , of howkins road , pleaded guilty to charges including dangerous driving , failing to stop for police and possessing cannabis , and was sentenced yesterday .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: watch : your 80-second weather forecast
text: here 's a look at tonight and tomorrow 's weather for the west midlands .
keep up-to-date with the bbc weather website at any other time .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: work starts on £ 200m jlr engineering and design centre
text: a ceremony to mark the official start of work at jaguar land rover 's new £ 200m design and engineering centre at gaydon was held today .
author: Stratford Herald

documents.title: plan for £ 392m 'midlands engine ' revealed
text: plan for £ 392m 'midlands engine ' revealed

documents.title: kurtley beale to return to australia
text: wasps have confirmed kurtley beale will return to australia at the end of the season , following his one-year deal with the club .

the club were keen to retain the australia back beyond his existing contract , but director of rugby , dai young , said all contract discussions have been `` very amicable '' and the player will leave in the summer .
the 28-year-old has scored three tries in six league games since joining , including two in .
saturday 's 24-3 win at bath .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: scheme to make people computer literate extended
text: a scheme , in which volunteers from coventry university help older people make better use of digital media , is to be extended across libraries in the city .
so far , around 150 volunteers have helped more than 500 people set up email accounts and use the internet , as well as smartphones , laptops and tablets , in the gen2gen scheme .
the project has so far only been available in the city centre , but is being extended to stoke and earlsdon libraries .

documents.title: friargate marketing blamed for lack of tenants
text: the developers of friargate `` need to be far more professional '' and `` upfront '' with the marketing of the scheme , according to the councillor in charge of city development .
but jim o'boyle , cabinet member for jobs and regeneration , said the council is currently negotiating with the developers , and is `` fairly confident we can get things moving '' .
the royal institute of chartered surveyors announced it would not be moving into the £ 30m development , meaning the city council will be the only occupants when it opens later this year .
the bbc has asked the developers , friargate coventry llp , for a statement .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coventry city asked to help pay ricoh arena repair costs after semi-final pitch invasion
text: coventry city have been asked about covering some of the cost of ricoh arena pitch repairs after supporters invaded the playing surface when the club secured its first trip to wembley in 30 years .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: your nature up close
text: these bbc weather watchers have been taking advantage of the sunny weather to take some great photos .
the bee was taken in coventry by kingfisher whisperer and the daffodils in wolston by melanie
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: wembley tickets almost gone ahead of general sales
text: just over 32,500 tickets have been sold for coventry city 's trip to wembley , out of the club 's allocation of 39,000 for the efl trophy final , says the club .
season ticket holders have so far been able to buy up to six each , with the tickets going on general sale from 09:00 on monday .
they can be bought from the butts park arena ticket office , but the club recommend buying online .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: midlands engine : where investment will be spent
text: the chancellor was in the west midlands this morning as the government set out its plans for the so-called midlands engine .
philip hammond was revealing where an investment of £ 392m will be spent .

documents.title: michelin restaurant poor for hygiene
text: michelin restaurant poor for hygiene

documents.title: funds raised to help family with costs of funeral
text: a fundraising campaign has been launched to help the family of a 31-year-old warwick woman who tragically died after a fire broke out .
author: Warwick Courier

documents.title: missing person connection to overturned car
text: no-one was injured when a car overturned in kenilworth today say warwickshire police .
warwickshire specials tweeted the collision involved a missing person , who 's now been reunited with their family .
sc iggo assists at a traffic accident in kenilworth involving a missing person .
missing person reunited with family and not injured .
rh

documents.title: spate of break-ins across warwick district
text: over the last week seven properties across kenliworth , leamington , warwick and rowington have been broken into .
author: Kenilworth Weekly News

documents.title: 'slap in the face ' for families not invited to iraq and afghanistan war memorial
text: the sister of a soldier killed in afghanistan has traveled to the dedication of a memorial to those who served , without an invitation , says a friend .
the unveiling of the memorial , by the queen , has been overshadowed by a row over the failure to include the families of the 682 service personnel who died in iraq and afghanistan .
victoria batemen told pa news she was travelling to the event at horse guards parade in whitehal with shanna , the sister of pte jeff `` jj '' doherty , from southam , warwickshire .
mrs bateman , 33 , described the situation as a `` bit of a slap in the face '' .
`` she has not been given an invite , but she is here and we are going to try and get her in , '' she said .

documents.title: more babies die before they are one in the west midlands than in any other part of the country
text: more babies die before their first birthday here in the west midlands than in any other part of the country , according to latest figures from the office of national statistics .
health professionals are trying to reduce the number of deaths by 20 % by 2021 .
often no-one knows for sure why this is happening .
maternity services are being overhauled and .
finnish-style baby boxes .
are being handed out to expectant mothers - finland has one of the lowest infant mortality rates in the world .
the lily mae foundation , based in balsall common , offers supports parents who have lost a baby to stillbirth or to neonatal death .
author: Sarah Bishop
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: spring budget : tax rises for the self-employed
text: chancellor philip hammond has increased national insurance bills for self-employed people in the spring budget .
the number of self-employed workers has increased notably in the west midlands in recent years .
most recent figures , released only last month , show the figure has risen by 14 % in five years and working men in the west midlands are about twice as likely to be self-employed as women .
so these changes will affect hundreds of thousands of people in our area , and more men than women .
author: Mike Taylor
BBC WM

documents.title: four wasps for six nations ' team
text: the wasps quartet of elliot daly , joe launchbury , james haskell and nathan hughes have r etained their places in england 's starting fifteen for this weekend 's calcutta cup match .
a victory for england on saturday would give the defending grand slam champions a record-equalling 18th consecutive win .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: checks that anglers are fishing legally
text: anglers in the southam area are being checked on by environment agency officers .
manager , dave throup tweets that they 're all legal so far .
fishery bailiffs out checking licences in southam area # warwickshire this morning .
all legal so far

documents.title: nuneaton 's armed forces day is renamed in jesse 's honour
text: a towering figure in the borough and the ex-service community will be remembered at an event incredibly close to his heart .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: co-op redevelopment scheme announced
text: plans for the redevelopment of the former 1950s co-op store in coventry have been unveiled .
the creation of around 60 residential apartments , along with provision for restaurants , shops and an indoor park , are included in the blueprint .
edg property , the firm behind the scheme , are showcasing the plans at the mipim property exhibition in cannes .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: big issue seller says he would be 'better off begging ' in town
text: a big issue seller says he would be better off begging as other homeless people are constantly `` stealing his pitch '' to beg .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: michelin star restaurant gets one-star hygiene rating
text: a michelin-starred restaurant in kenilworth has been told to improve its standards of hygiene after receiving one of the lowest ratings following an inspection .
the improvement notice was served on the cross by officers from warwick district council , on behalf of the food standards agency .
problems included ice being stored under the sink and issues surrounding a vacuum packer for raw food .
a spokesperson said the restaurant takes the issue `` extremely seriously '' and the issues raised resulted from a `` paperwork misunderstanding '' and a `` broken vacuum packing machine '' .

the cross had a four star rating in december prior to this inspection , little has changed in the set up or personnel , we re-applied hoping for an even better score at a revisit arranged for january 2017 .
at the revisit one of our vacuum packing machines was broken - we had implemented controls to protect customers but the inspector marked us down for the issue .

documents.title: travel : m6 congestion
text: an earlier incident is causing congestion on the m6 northbound , between j3 ( a444 ) and j3a .
all lanes have re-opened , but there 's queuing traffic back to j2 , ( m69 ) .
the incident is having a knock-on effect on other roads , with heavy traffic reported on the a444 , a45 and a4600 ansty road .
heavy congestion on a444 jimmy hill way heading towards m6 j3 due to an earlier incident on m6 .
please avoid if possible
also , affecting a45 and a4600 ansty road
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: good evening from the coventry & warwickshire newsroom
text: that 's it for your live updates on wednesday , but keep an eye out for any breaking news throughout the evening .
will be back giving you the latest news , sport , travel and weather at 8:00 tomorrow .

documents.title: budget analysis : what does the chancellor 's speech mean to you ?
text: `` spreadsheet phil '' , as the chancellor is known , gave a much more entertaining and humorous performance today than many expected , even cracking a few jokes at his love of sums .
local publicans will no doubt be thrilled to hear that they 'll be getting a £ 1000 discount on the rate of tax they pay for their buildings .
the midlands region got three mentions in the chancellor 's speech today , .
and tomorrow the government will be unveiling its plan to boost economic growth in the region - the so-called `` midlands engine strategy '' .
warwickshire county council 's izzi seccombe has led calls from council leaders for more cash to plug the funding crisis in adult social care .

she says the chancellor 's announcement today of an extra £ 2bn for social care is a `` big step '' but she still has `` concerns '' that it wo n't be enough and wants to see the finer details of the policy .
author: Shelley Phelps
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire, Political Reporter

documents.title: police hunt assault suspect who failed to appear in court
text: a warrant has been issued after a man due in court on indecent assault charges failed to turn up .
robert edward edmondson , aged 48 , from windsor street , coventry , was due to appear at warwick court court on 21 february .
he is described as white , 5ft 8ins tall , of slim to medium build and with short dark hair .
police have urged anyone with information about his whereabouts to call warwickshire police on 101 .

documents.title: stratford restaurant bamboodle stripped of its licence
text: a string of complaints from its neighbours has seen stratford-upon-avon restaurant bamboodle have its licence taken away .
people living near to the street food venue on union street had complained about noise , disturbances and anti-social behaviour .
when officers visited they found door staff did n't know how many people were inside , customers causing trouble outside and too much noise .
the district council 's licensing team , warwickshire police and warwickshire fire gave evidence against the bar , which has 21 days to appeal .
author: Navkiran Mann
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: your photos : spring flowers in leamington 's jephson gardens
text: spring has sprung in leamington spa , as this bright of crocuses shows .
flowers and fountains at leamington spa .
today 's weather photo for @ twitterid is from janine king
